title: Michael Caine supported by walking stick on set of Oliver Twist remake
text:
Michael Caine was spotted arriving on the movie set for the Oliver Twist remake (Picture: Backgrid)

Michael Caine has been spotted arriving on the movie set for the Oliver Twist remake, with his walking stick in tow.

The 86-year-old, who will be taking on the role of Fagin, rocked on up to the London location in a black four-by-four.

And he looked particularly smart in his navy jacket and blue denim shirt, that he’d matched with a pair of black trousers.

The star was supported by his wooden cane, which he’s been using since he suffered from an ankle injury in late 2018 due to a nasty slip on ice.

At the time, his spokesperson said: ‘Michael slipped and broke his ankle in his garden during the recent heavy snow. He is in fine health and great spirits.’

The actor added: ‘It’s coming along fine, it’s just tremendous inconvenience.’

He was supported by his walking stick (Picture: Backgrid)

However, that hasn’t stopped him from taking on new projects, and he appeared excited to start work on Twist.

He said of the Sky Cinema hit: ‘Fagin is such an infamous character, it’s going to be great fun playing him.

‘I’m really looking forward to working with Lena, Raff and the rest of the cast in London when we start shooting.’

Joining the likes of Rita Ora, Jude Law’s son, Rafferty Law, and Lena Headey, David Walliams will also be making an appearance in the musical as the much-loved character Losberne.

The star will be playing Fagin (Picture: Backgrid)

A source close to the project told the MailOnline: ‘Shooting for the new film starts today and everyone is very excited to get started.

‘Twist is a modern interpretation of Charles Dickens’ Oliver in which the title character has been reinvented as a streetwise artist living on the streets of modern-day London.

‘Rafferty impressed with his screen presence and his edginess brings a whole new dimension to the role of Oliver.

‘It’s an all-star cast with David in the mix after arriving at today’s first rehearsal – not to mention Rita and Sir Michael Caine.’

The Let You Love Me songstress as also spotted in character as she donned a bleached blonde wig.

She was seen taking on the role of Dodger, while she chased Rafferty (who is playing Oliver) around the city streets.
